{{pp-semi-protected|small=yes}} [[Image:Webcomic xkcd - Wikipedian protester.png|thumb|300px|right|alt=Innovative application for the template in xkcd 285 (Wikipedian Protester)|The {{Tl|Citation needed}} template aims to promote [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|accountable]] discourse.]] {{Notice|A complete version of this documentation is provided at [[Template:Citation needed]]. An encyclopedia article about the template is at [[Citation needed]].}}
To ensure that all Wikipedia content is [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|verifiable]], anyone may question an [[Wikipedia:Citing sources#When and why to cite sources|uncited claim]] by inserting a ''<nowiki>{{Citation needed}}, {{fact}}, or {{cn}}</nowiki>'' tag.
{{quotation|'''Example:''' 65% of people believe in ghosts.<!--{{Citation needed}} begin-->{{fix |link=Wikipedia:Citation needed#Citation needed |text=citation needed |class=noprint Template-Fact }}<!--{{Citation needed}} end--> }}
* Exercise caution before relying upon unsourced claims. * If you can provide a [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources|reliable source]] for the claim, please [[Wikipedia:Be bold|be bold]] and [[Wikipedia:Tutorial (Editing)|replace]] the "Citation needed" template with enough information to locate the source. You may leave the [[Copy editing|copyediting]] to someone else, or learn more about [[Wikipedia:Citing sources|citing sources on Wikipedia]]. * If someone tagged your contributions with "Citation needed" and you disagree, discuss the matter on the article's [[Help:Using talk pages|discussion page]]. * Controversial, poorly-sourced claims in biographies of living people [[Wikipedia:Biographies of living persons#Remove unsourced or poorly sourced contentious material|should be deleted immediately]].
